steps.title: Dust your bamboo blinds using a feather duster or a soft, clean cloth to remove dust particles from between the blind slats.
steps.content: Dust your bamboo blinds using a feather duster or a soft, clean cloth to remove dust particles from between the blind slats.

steps.title: Use a vacuum cleaner with a special attachment that will prevent scratches from marking the bamboo wood, such as a soft brush, to remove dust particles and existing cobwebs.
steps.content: Use a vacuum cleaner with a special attachment that will prevent scratches from marking the bamboo wood, such as a soft brush, to remove dust particles and existing cobwebs.

steps.title: Dust your bamboo blinds on a regular basis every 4 to 5 days.
steps.content: Dust your bamboo blinds on a regular basis every 4 to 5 days. If your bamboo blinds begin to mildew or collect other dirt and filth such as cobwebs that cannot be removed by dusting, you may need to wash them with a water and oil soap, vinegar, or bleach mixture.

steps.title: Fill up your bathtub or a large washing tub with enough hot water to completely immerse and cover your blinds.
steps.content: Fill up your bathtub or a large washing tub with enough hot water to completely immerse and cover your blinds.

steps.title: Add a natural oil soap product safe to use on wood to the water.
steps.content: Add a natural oil soap product safe to use on wood to the water.

steps.title: Add the specified amount as directed on the manufacturer's packaging.
steps.content: Add the specified amount as directed on the manufacturer's packaging. You can also use white vinegar as an alternative to a commercial oil soap product. Use 1 cup (250 ml) of white vinegar in every 1 gallon (3.8 L) of water. If you are treating your bamboo blinds specifically for mildew or mold, substitute the oil soap and water mixture with one part bleach for every 2 parts water.

steps.title: Place your blinds in the soap and water mixture.
steps.content: Place your blinds in the soap and water mixture. You may need to clean one panel or blind at a time depending on their size.

steps.title: Soak the blinds for several minutes or until grime can easily be removed using a soft sponge or washcloth.
steps.content: Soak the blinds for several minutes or until grime can easily be removed using a soft sponge or washcloth.

steps.title: Use a soft sponge or washcloth to remove excess dirt and grime and gently scrub each blind or slat until they are all clean.
steps.content: Use a soft sponge or washcloth to remove excess dirt and grime and gently scrub each blind or slat until they are all clean.

steps.title: Remove the blinds from the water and place them on a clean towel.
steps.content: Remove the blinds from the water and place them on a clean towel.

steps.title: Drain the water from the tub and rinse the blinds in warm water from a shower or sink until all the soap has been completely washed away.
steps.content: Drain the water from the tub and rinse the blinds in warm water from a shower or sink until all the soap has been completely washed away.

steps.title: Place or hang your bamboo blinds in a dry, well-ventilated area to allow them to dry completely.
steps.content: Place or hang your bamboo blinds in a dry, well-ventilated area to allow them to dry completely. You may place the blinds in direct sunlight for a minimum of 20 minutes or until they are completely dry. Do not place your blinds in a moist, damp environment like a steamy bathroom because it may cause mildew to form on your blinds.

steps.title: Wash your bamboo blinds on a regular basis every month or as needed.
steps.content: Wash your bamboo blinds on a regular basis every month or as needed.
